description: connect to hubspot apis to interact with your hubspot account and perform a variety of different actions.

blocks.name: getContentEvents

args.name: startDate
args.info: The beginning value of the query range, in UTC, in milliseconds

args.name: endDate
args.info: The end value of the query range, in UTC, in milliseconds

args.name: hapikey
args.info: API key if Authorization header isn't present

args.name: limit
args.info: The maximum number of items to return. Defaults to 100.

args.name: offset
args.info: Starting value to page by. Defaults to 0.

args.name: contentCategory
args.info: The category of content to filter by, values include "blog-post", "email"

args.name: campaignGuid
args.info: Show tasks by campaign guid. Multiple can be specified.
args.includeNoCampaigns: Show tasks without a campaign specified (true, false). Defaults to false.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: if hapikey isn't present

blocks.description: Get events from the calendar. The endpoint supports filtering to get the specific events you want.

args.name: hapikey
args.info: API key if Authorization header isn't present

args.name: limit
args.info: The maximum number of items to return. Defaults to 100.

args.name: offset
args.info: Starting value to page by. Defaults to 0.

args.name: contentCategory
args.info: The category of content to filter by, values include "blog-post", "email"

args.name: campaignGuid

blocks.description: Get events from the calendar. The endpoint supports filtering to get the specific events you want.

blocks.name: createTask

args.name: hapikey
args.info: API key if Authorization header is not present

args.name: accessToken
args.info: if hapikey isn't present

args.name: eventDate
args.info: When the task is set to be due, in milliseconds since the epoch

args.name: eventType
args.info: Type of calendar event; for tasks this is always PUBLISHING_TASK

args.name: category
args.info: type of task; one of BLOG_POST, EMAIL, LANDING_PAGE, CUSTOM

args.name: state
args.info: value of TODO or DONE

args.name: campaignGuid
args.info: value of campaign GUID associated with Task

args.name: name
args.info: Name of Task

args.name: description
args.info: description of Task

args.name: ownerId
args.info: HubSpot id of the user that the task is assigned to. See the Owners API to get a list of owner Ids

args.name: topicIds
args.info: Array: The list of ids of topics associated with the associated Blog Post, if any. Otherwise null. Only read for BLOG_POST Tasks. See Topics API to get a list of topic ids.

args.name: contentGroupId
args.info: The ID of the content group (aka blog) that the associated Blog Post will belong to, if any. Only read for BLOG_POST Tasks. See Blog API to get a list of blogs ids.

args.name: templatePath
args.info: (optional) The template to use for emails and landing pages. only read for EMAIL and LANDING_PAGE categories.

blocks.description: Create a new Task. Creating a task of type BLOG_POST, EMAIL, or LANDING_PAGE will create a draft of the respective content and associate it with the Task, returning a contentId in the response.

blocks.name: getCalendarTaskByID

args.name: taskId
args.info: The ID of the required task

args.name: hapikey
args.info: API key if Authorization header isn't present

args.name: accessToken
args.info: if hapikey isn't present

blocks.description:
Get a specific calendar task by ID.
This endpoint returns a a task by specifying the ID of that task

blocks.name: updateCalendarTask

args.name: hapikey
args.info: API key if Authorization header isn't present

args.name: taskId
args.info: Unique identifier for the task to delete

args.name: accessToken
args.info: if hapikey isn't present

args.name: eventDate
args.info: When the task is set to be due, in milliseconds since the epoch

args.name: eventType
args.info: Type of calendar event; for tasks this is always PUBLISHING_TASK

args.name: category
args.info: type of task; one of BLOG_POST, EMAIL, LANDING_PAGE, CUSTOM. This must match existing value.

args.name: state
args.info: value of TODO or DONE

args.name: category
args.info: type of task; one of BLOG_POST, EMAIL, LANDING_PAGE, CUSTOM. This must match existing value.

args.name: campaignGuid
args.info: value of campaign GUID associated with Task

args.name: topicIds
args.info: The list of ids of topics associated with the associated Blog Post, if any. Otherwise null. Only read for BLOG_POST Tasks. See Topics API to get a list of topic ids.

args.name: name
args.info: Name of Task

args.name: description
args.info: description of Task.

args.name: ownerId
args.info: HubSpot id of the user that the task is assigned to. See the Owners API to get a list of owner Ids.

blocks.description: Update a Task. this action will replace any existing allowed fields specified. Any fields not included will not change from existing values.

blocks.name: deleteCalendarTask

args.name: hapikey
args.info: API key if Authorization header isn't present

args.name: taskId
args.info: Unique identifier for the task to delete

args.name: accessToken
args.info: if hapikey isn't present

blocks.description: Deletes Task from system. If there is a content object (Blog post, email, landing page) associated, they will not be affected.

blocks.name: createACompany

args.name: hapikey
args.info: API key if Authorization header isn't present

args.name: accessToken
args.info: if hapikey isn't present

args.name: companyJSON
args.info: This is JSON that represents a company that you're creating. This should be in the format of the code sample below.

blocks.description: For a given portal, create a company. This is particularly useful if you're integrating with a CRM or another application that has a similar notion of a company.

blocks.name: updateACompany

args.name: hapikey
args.info: API key if Authorization header isn't present

args.name: companyId
args.info: Unique identifier for a particular company.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: if hapikey isn't present

args.name: companyJSON
args.info: This is JSON that represents a company that you're creating. This should be in the format of the code sample below.

blocks.description:
Updates the existing company with the id :companyId with the properties as specified by JSON in the request body

Returns JSON representing the updated company.

blocks.name: updateAGroupOfCompanies

args.name: hapikey
args.info: API key if Authorization header isn't present

args.name: accessToken
args.info: if hapikey isn't present

args.name: objectId
args.info: The companyId of the company that you want to update.

args.name: properties
args.info: A list of properties that you want to update. Each property must include the name of the property to be updated, and the value of the property to update to..

blocks.description:
Update a group of existing company records by their companyId.
This endpoint takes a list of objectIds and that correspond to the companyId of the company you want to update, and a list of properties to update for that company.

blocks.name: deleteACompany

args.name: companyId
args.info: Unique identifier for a particular company.

args.name: hapikey
args.info: API key if Authorization header isn't present

args.name: accessToken
args.info: if hapikey isn't present

blocks.description:
Deletes the exisiting company specified by :companyId. Returns JSON indicating whether or not the specified company was actually deleted.

Since companies play a central role in the CRM, it is a best practice not to delete a company unless your application has created them.

blocks.name: getAllCompanies

args.name: hapikey
args.info: API key if Authorization header isn't present

args.name: Limit
args.info: The number of records to return. Defaults to 100, has a maximum value of 250.

args.name: Offset
args.info: Used to page through the results. If there are more records in your portal than the limit= parameter, you will need to use the offset returned in the first request to get the next set of results.

args.name: Properties
args.info: Used to include specific company properties in the results.  By default, the results will only include the company ID, and will not include the values for any properties for your companies.  Including this parameter will include the data for the specified property in the results.  You can include this parameter multiple times to request multiple properties. Note:to pass multiple Properties pass  a comma separated list of arguments.

args.name: PropertiesWithHistory
args.info: Works similarly to properties=, but this parameter will include the history for the specified property, instead of just including the current value. Use this parameter when you need the full history of changes to a property's value.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: if hapikey isn't present

blocks.description:
Used to get all of the companies in a portal. Returns a paginated list of companies.

In addition to the list of companies, each request will also return two values, offset and has-more. If has-more is true, you'll need to make another request, using the offset to get the next page of company records.

blocks.name: getRecentlyModifiedCompanies

args.name: hapikey
args.info: API key if Authorization header isn't present

args.name: offset
args.info: This is used to get the next page of results. Each request will return an offset in the response, and you'd use that offset in the URL of your next request to get the next page of results.

args.name: Count
args.info: Specifies the number of companies to be returned.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: if hapikey isn't present

blocks.description: Returns a list of all companies sorted by the date the companies were most recently modified. This is particularly useful for ongoing syncs with HubSpot in which changes to companies must be captured in another system.

blocks.name: getRecentlyCreatedCompanies

args.name: hapikey
args.info: API key if Authorization header isn't present

args.name: offset
args.info: This is used to get the next page of results. Each request will return an offset in the response, and you'd use that offset in the URL of your next request to get the next page of results.

args.name: Count
args.info: Specifies the number of companies to be returned.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: if hapikey isn't present

blocks.description: Returns a list of all companies sorted by the date the companies were created. This is particularly useful for ongoing syncs with HubSpot in which changes to companies must be captured in another system.

blocks.name: getACompany

args.name: companyId
args.info: Unique identifier for a particular company.

args.name: hapikey
args.info: API key if Authorization header isn't present

args.name: accessToken
args.info: if hapikey isn't present

blocks.description: Returns an object representing the company with the id :companyId associated with the specified portal. Particularly useful if you're performing lookups on specific attributes of a company.

blocks.name: getContactsAtACompany

args.name: companyId
args.info: Unique identifier for a particular company.

args.name: hapikey
args.info: API key if Authorization header isn't present

args.name: Count
args.info: Specifies the number of contacts to be returned.

args.name: VidOffset
args.info: The vid to offset the query by.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: if hapikey isn't present

blocks.description:
Returns all of the contacts who have an associatedcompanyid contact property of :companyid. For more on how contacts are associated with companies, check out our Companies API Overview.

This will return 20 contacts by default. You can get up to 100 contacts per request using the count= parameter. You can use the "vidoffset": field returned in the results with the vidOffset= parameter to get the next set of results.

blocks.name: getContactIDsAtACompany

args.name: companyId
args.info: Unique identifier for a particular company.

args.name: hapikey
args.info: API key if Authorization header isn't present

args.name: Count
args.info: Specifies the number of contacts to be returned.

args.name: VidOffset
args.info: The vid to offset the query by.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: if hapikey isn't present

blocks.description:
Returns all of the contact IDs who have an associatedcompanyid property of :companyid. Useful if you're not looking for any more information on contacts at a company other than that they exist and where to find more information on them.

This will return 100 contacts by default, which is the maximum number of records you can get in a single request. You can get fewer contacts per request using the count= parameter. You can use the "vidoffset": field returned in the results with the vidOffset= parameter to get the next set of results.

blocks.name: addContactToCompany

args.name: contactVID
args.info: The ID of a contact to add a company.

args.name: companyID
args.info: The ID of a company to add a contact to.

args.name: hapikey
args.info: API key if Authorization header isn't present

args.name: accessToken
args.info: if hapikey isn't present

blocks.description: Associate a given contact to a company. If a contact is already associated to a different company, the contact will be moved to the new company. A contact can only be associated to one company.

blocks.name: removeContactFromCompany

args.name: contactVID
args.info: The ID of a contact to add a company.

args.name: companyID
args.info: The ID of a company to add a contact to.

args.name: hapikey
args.info: API key if Authorization header isn't present

args.name: accessToken
args.info: if hapikey isn't present

blocks.description: Remove a contact from a company. Once complete the contact will not be associated to any company.
